definition: to forget and not bear recriminations (idiom); to let bygones be bygones/There is no point in crying over spilt milk.
already/since/both... (and...)
to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous
(negative prefix)/not/no
fault/to blame/to punish/calamity/misfortune

sentences.english: He is sophisticated enough to laugh things off and let bygones be bygones.
sentences.chinese: 他成熟老練，對事一笑了之，既往不咎。

sentences.english: "You have to let bygones be bygones, " says McLaughlin.
sentences.chinese: “你必須既往不咎，”麥克勞克林說。

sentences.english: We must let bygones be bygones.
There's no point in bearing a grudge. Let us forget about it, no postmortem.
sentences.chinese: 沒必要心懷怨恨，讓我們把它忘掉，既往不咎。

sentences.english: Our attitude is one of letting bygones be bygones.
sentences.chinese: 我們的態度是既往不咎。

sentences.english: Accept you to array thing Be getting noer postmortems?
sentences.chinese: 收你點東西就既往不咎了？

sentences.english: Rely on the same old needlepoint philosophy of "forgive and forget"?
sentences.chinese: 就靠信仰那些“既往不咎”的古老哲學？

sentences.english: When God forgives a sin, He never brings it up again.
sentences.chinese: 上帝若赦免了罪，祂就既往不咎。

sentences.english: Why don't you let bygones be bygones and ask him round for a drink?
sentences.chinese: 你爲何不既往不咎，請他過來喝一杯酒呢？

sentences.english: The Chinese people's attitude is one of letting bygones be bygones.
sentences.chinese: 中國人民的態度是既往不咎。

definition: to write off at one stroke
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
magnanimous (idiom); generous
magnanimous (idiom)/generous
not censure sb for his past misdeeds/overlook sb's past mistakes/let bygones be bygones
to atone for one's crimes by meritorious acts
to surrender and pay allegiance to
to pardon/to absolve/to exempt from punishment
see 將功贖罪|将功赎罪[jiang1 gong1 shu2 zui4]
completely correcting one's former misdeeds (idiom); to repent past mistakes and turn over a new leaf/a reformed character
to regret/to repent
stupid/stubborn/pigheaded
to forgive easily/to let off lightly (often with negative: you won't get away with it)
to get back on the right path/to mend one's ways
not to be repeated/not to be taken as a precedent/just this once
to forget former enmity (idiom)
